channel.title: Sqrew Pythagoras and his theorem
channel.description:
I'm in 8th Grade Geometry, and I have to say.... I'm fucking sick of Pythagor[b]ass[/b] and his fucking theorem.
,|, (-_-) ,|,
Sorry... I just had to say it! It was pissing me off after a final that I had to use it like 10 times.

item.title: Sqrew Pythagoras and his theorem
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

Maths is easy as… The only reason I haven’t got 100 on math tests at school is either because it was stats (writing shit… but still I didn’t get anything wrong, I just didn’t get an Achieved With Excellence) or I made a speed error.

Read full topic

item.title: Sqrew Pythagoras and his theorem
item.dc:creator: @xerozcheez xerozcheez
item.description:
@xerozcheez wrote:

[quote=“BobDole81, post:39, topic:3861”]You’ve never heard of Pythagoras? I remember doing a report in grade 6 or something on the Pythagorean theory and its proof using squares…

Anyway, Pythagoras is a who, not a what, unless you’re talking about the Pythagoreans…Pythagoras was a Greek mathematician/philosopher/musician/astronomer/(anything else someone educated could be at the time) who was pretty much the founder of logical number theory - he also came up with such ideas as the pythagorean theorem and the fundementals of perfect numbers and such. He also started a society called the Pythagoreans who had much social influence at the time (around 500 odd BC)…dunno if anyone wanted to know that stuff, but now you know :D[/quote]

Oh I’ve heard of it, I just never really payed attention at that sort of thing in school XD

Read full topic

item.title: Sqrew Pythagoras and his theorem
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

You’ve never heard of Pythagoras? I remember doing a report in grade 6 or something on the Pythagorean theory and its proof using squares…

Anyway, Pythagoras is a who, not a what, unless you’re talking about the Pythagoreans…Pythagoras was a Greek mathematician/philosopher/musician/astronomer/(anything else someone educated could be at the time) who was pretty much the founder of logical number theory - he also came up with such ideas as the pythagorean theorem and the fundementals of perfect numbers and such. He also started a society called the Pythagoreans who had much social influence at the time (around 500 odd BC)…dunno if anyone wanted to know that stuff, but now you know
